msg: hi @undefined! What you coming in from? and what's your research topic?
also, speaking of which, I've been meaning to share a little doc explaining my own research project, so here it is for anyone who's been curious (still a work in progress :slightly_smiling_face: )
https://hackmd.io/s/By1-F1_6Q

hey, good to meet you! my main research question is on what allows a civic tech initiative to actually succeed - that is, to have significant amounts of both citizen intake and government response.  from my research, g0v is pretty unique in comparison to a lot of other communities/initiatives terms of having real impact, and i want to get a better idea of the factors that make that possible in my time in taiwan
i actually go to school at dartmouth, so i’m in the middle of nowhere (read: new hampshire) right now.  but Los Angeles is where I call home
Right on, happy to share my raw materials (which will be in that doc) as i compile them, so you have to ask less of the silly questions I've had to :)

Maybe we should start a #participatory-research channel (or better name?), so everyone -- Taiwanese folks and otherwise -- know where these conversations between curious outside stakeholders are happening, and its not something that seems mysterious

Maybe we should start a #participatory-research channel (or better name?), so everyone -- Taiwanese folks and otherwise -- know where these conversations between curious outside stakeholders are happening, and its not something that seems mysterious
Any feedback on this proposal, @chihao? :heart:

that would be awesome!! i also actually have a bunch of questions about how to get involved while not being a local (and also without the best mandarin/taiwanese comprehension haha) if that’s something you could speak on as well!
@kevinliao @agameofprivacy 你們會在開團區或對話志工 FB group 貼這個嗎～？還是我來幫貼呢？
呀我來推吧

my buddy who is a sitting ny state senator is flying out to taiwan for an official visit. i told him he needs to hear about the vTaiwan process/practice. besides audrey & official gov people, whom else should he meet with?
fyi - he is the sponsor of nys' single payer healthcare bill.
@noneck Watchout is happy to meet with him and exchange ideas :) We are a congressional watchdog org / news media / democracy lab.
Some English info can be found here: https://watchout.tw/overseas
The next g0v big hackathon will be on 12/8. @jc I guess you are not in Taipei by that time yet?
@patcon I think it’s great to have a place to talk about participatory / open / communal research methodologies / inspirations / stories! A channel or a hackmd would both be great imo.

@undefined I think your questions about getting involved from afar could apply to more ppl! Would you consider starting a shared doc (many g0v ppl use hackmd) to list those questions out? This way there can be a communal convo on this topic :)
@undefined Also check out this doc for journalists and researchers: https://g0v.hackmd.io/hgXdOpyZRPCK1HVBVGmIhA does it help you? Are you seeing something missing that should be in the doc?
@mrorz 要在今天結束前完成嗎？
恩希望如此 QQ
